org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.util

Interface CoverageMap<T extends Rangeable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Type of element in the coverage map.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<CoverageRegion<T>>

    public interface CoverageMap<T extends Rangeable>
extends Iterable<CoverageRegion<T>>
    A CoverageMap is an Object that contains coverage information for a contiguous range of offset values. Coverage is defined as the number of elements that are span a given offset. The coverage at each offset may be different since a different number of objects may span different locations. Since adjacent offsets often have the same coverage information, contiguous regions that contain the same exact elements (and therefore the same exact coverage) are combined into CoverageRegion objects. Adjacent CoverageRegions may have the same depth of coverage but will not contain the same exact elements.

    For example, a CoverageMap of a Contig will show where each of its AssembledReads align to the contig consensus. Each consensus offset will have a different level of coverage because each consensus offset will have a different number of reads aligned to it.

    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfRegions

        int getNumberOfRegions()
        Get the number of CoverageRegions.
        Returns:
        the number of regions will always be ≥ 0.

      • getRegion

        CoverageRegion<T> getRegion(int i)
        Get the ith CoverageRegion.
        Parameters:
        i - the index into this coverage map; where 0 ≤ i < getNumberOfRegions()
        Returns:
        the ith CoverageRegion will never be null but may have 0 depth of coverage.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 or i ≥ getNumberOfRegions().

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Does this CoverageMap have any CoverageRegions.
        Returns:
        true if getNumberOfRegions() < 0; false otherwise.

      • getStats

        CoverageMapStats getStats()
        Get the CoverageMapStats for this coverage map. Some implementations may cache these values so it is more efficient to call this method then manually compute them everytime yourself.
        Returns:
        the CoverageMapStats for this map; will never be null.

      • getAverageCoverage

        double getAverageCoverage()
        Get the average coverage depth at each offset in the coverage map. This is the same as (but may be more efficient than): 
         long totalLength = 0L;
 long totalCoverage =0L;
 for(CoverageRegion region : this){
     long rangeLength =region.asRange().getLength();
     totalLength += rangeLength;
     totalCoverage += region.getCoverageDepth() * rangeLength;
 }
 avgCoverage = totalLength==0? 0D : totalCoverage/(double)totalLength;
        Returns:
        the average coverage depth will always be ≥ 0.

      • getMinCoverage

        int getMinCoverage()
        Get the lowest coverage depth of any CoverageRegion in the coverage map.
        Returns:
        the lowest coverage depth.

      • getMaxCoverage

        int getMaxCoverage()
        Get the highest coverage depth of any CoverageRegion in the coverage map.
        Returns:
        the highest coverage depth.

      • getRegionsWhichIntersect

        List<CoverageRegion<T>> getRegionsWhichIntersect(Range range)
        Get a List of all the CoverageRegions in this CoverageMap that intersect the given Range.
        Parameters:
        range - the Range to get all the coverageRegions for.
        Returns:
        A List of CoverageRegions; if the coverage map does not contain any CoverageRegions that intersect the given range, then the returned List will be empty. Will never return null. It is possible that CoverageRegions returned may have 0 depth of coverage.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.

      • getRegionWhichCovers

        CoverageRegion<T> getRegionWhichCovers(long offset)
        Get the CoverageRegion that provides coverage for the given offset (in 0-based). If this coverage map includes the given offset, then the returned CoverageRegion's Range will intersect the given offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to
        Returns:
        a CoverageRegion if this CoverageMap contains this offset; or null if this coverage map does not contain this offset. It is possible for the returned CoverageRegion to have 0 depth of coverage.

      • regions

        Stream<CoverageRegion<T>> regions()
        Create a Stream of all the CoverageRegions in this Coverage Map.
        Returns:
        a new Stream.
        Since:
        5.0

      • regions

        Stream<CoverageRegion<T>> regions(Range range)
        Create a Stream of all the CoverageRegions in this Coverage Map that intersect the given Range coordinates. This should return an equivalent Stream as 
          getRegionsWhichIntersect(range).stream()
        but might be more efficient.
        Parameters:
        range - the Range to get all the coverageRegions for.
        Returns:
        a new Stream
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        Since:
        5.0
